derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from dialect clam 'to be sticky or adhere', of Germanic origin; related to clay

entry.def: Something that is clammy is unpleasantly damp or sticky.

example.ex: Think of the clammy hands you get when you visit the dentist!...
example.tran: 想想你去看牙医时那双黏糊糊的手！

example.ex: My shirt was clammy with sweat.

sentences.en: He clutched the cane in his clammy hand.
sentences.cn: 他那湿冷的手紧抓住手杖。

sentences.en: She gave a little shudder when she touched his clammy hand.
sentences.cn: 摸到他湿冷的手时，她微微一颤。

sentences.en: My shirt stuck to the clammy sweat on my back.
sentences.cn: 衬衫贴到我汗津津的背上。
